com.bigdata.relation.rule.eval.pipeline

Class JoinTask.ThreadLocalFactory<T extends IBuffer<E>,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.relation.rule.eval.pipeline.JoinTask.ThreadLocalFactory<T,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generic type of the thread-local object.
    Enclosing class:
    JoinTask

    public abstract class JoinTask.ThreadLocalFactory<T extends IBuffer<E>,E>
extends Object
    A factory pattern for per-thread objects whose life cycle is tied to some container. For example, there may be an instance of this pool for a JoinTask or an AbstractBTree. The pool can be torn down when the container is torn down, which prevents its thread-local references from escaping.
    Author:
    thompsonbry@users.sourceforge.net

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public final int size()
        Return the #of thread-local objects.

      • add

        public void add(E e)
        Add the element to the thread-local buffer.
        Parameters:
        e - An element.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the factory is asynchronously closed.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flush each of the unsynchronized buffers onto their backing synchronized buffer.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the join is halted.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset each of the synchronized buffers, discarding their buffered writes.

        Note: This method is used during error processing, therefore it DOES NOT check JoinTask.halt.

      • initialValue

        protected abstract T initialValue()
        Create and return a new object.
